skillTree.name: The Skewering Branch
skillTree.description: No hide nor armour can stand against the piercing fury of a Dryad or Tree Kin's savage limbs.

effects.description:
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +3 for Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Armour-piercing weapon damage: +10 for Tree Kin units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Skin of the Woods
skillTree.description: Hewn from the same forest that surrounds them, Tree Kin withstand attacks like the forest withstands the fury of the seasons.

effects.description:
Ward save: 20% for Tree Kin units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Dark Heart
skillTree.description: The wild beasts of the forest always sense the emotions of the Treemen, empathising with their pain over eons of loss.

effects.description:
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +3 for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks, Giant Wolves and Feral Bears units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks, Giant Wolves and Feral Bears units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +5% for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks, Giant Wolves and Feral Bears units
	(Lord's army)

Armour-piercing weapon damage: +6 for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks, Giant Wolves and Feral Bears units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks, Giant Wolves and Feral Bears units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks, Giant Wolves and Feral Bears units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Scent of Blood
skillTree.description: The promise of spilt blood rouses the forest’s predators from their lairs, salivating in anticipation of the slaughter.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Frenzy" for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks, Giant Wolves and Feral Bears units
	(Lord's army)
Recruitment cost: -25% for units recruited from the Wild Spirits panel

skillTree.name: Nature’s Vengeance
skillTree.description: Those at forest fringes where the Wargrove is known to dwell gather anything but deadwood at their peril!

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +10 for Dryad, Tree Kin and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)
"Roused to Wrath" ability gains increased range, and the summoned Dryads no longer degrade

skillTree.name: Roots of Woe
skillTree.description: Many believe Drycha lost her mind when Morghur’s blood was spilt amongst the roots of the once-glorious creature known as the Tree of Woe.

skillTree.name: Indoctrinator
skillTree.description: After years examining the Elves’ every action, the Briarmaven knows how to exploit their strengths as well as their weaknesses.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"

Replaces the "Glamoured" passive ability with "Insidious Glamour" for all Elf units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Shifting Woods
skillTree.description: The verdant labyrinth of the forest unsettles even the most courageous soul.

effects.description:
Hidden effect to grant Fear along with Terror
	(Lord's army)

Attribute: Causes Fear and Terror when ambushing in forests
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: The Natural Order
skillTree.description: The Ancients’ former handmaidens were once the forest’s overseers, taming the Winds to bring sustenance to bough and branch – that time will come again.

skillTree.name: Mantra of the Fallen
skillTree.description: Many are the spirits Drycha believes have been failed by the Asrai, their names remembered by the enchantments of her unending mantra.

effects.description: Hidden effect that removes lvl 2 version of Roused to Wrath from the character

Enemy leadership: -8 for Elven units
	(enemy armies in local province)

Leadership: +8 for Dryads, Tree Kin and Treemen units
	(Lord's army)
"Roused to Wrath" ability gains an additional charge and infinite range

skillTree.name: Foe-Seeker
skillTree.description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.

skillTree.name: Endurance of the Oak
skillTree.description: Taking their cue from the forest itself, the Lord endures and overcomes all.

skillTree.name: Impenetrable Bark
skillTree.description: Using the forest itself as a shield, this Lord is protected by their devotion to Athel Loren.

skillTree.name: Tempered Rigour
skillTree.description: When to strike, when to block, when to dodge. These are all skills the warriors of Athel Loren must perfect.

skillTree.name: Violent Delights
skillTree.description: There is no greater thrill than to be in the midst of battle, slaughtering in the forest's name.

skillTree.name: Deadly Onslaught
skillTree.description: The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

skillTree.name: Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma
skillTree.description: The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.

ui_effects.description: Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Smoke & Mirrors
skillTree.description: A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.

skillTree.name: The Enfeebling Foe
skillTree.description: When cast this spell enfeebles enemy minds; they feel the crushing weight of reality bearing down upon them.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Enfeebling Foe"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"

skillTree.name: The Withering
skillTree.description: The Wizard destroys their enemies from within, corroding foes' minds with doubt and crisis.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Withering"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Withering Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Withering Upgraded"

skillTree.name: The Penumbral Pendulum
skillTree.description: A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Penumbral Pendulum"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Pit of Shades
skillTree.description: The spellcaster opens a vortex leading into the Pit. Anything caught within it will be lost forever.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Okkam's Mindrazor
skillTree.description: The supernatural solution is often the best; weapons materialise before the caster's allies, allowing them to slice through flesh, soul, and consciousness.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Okkam's Mindrazor"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Earthing
skillTree.description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

skillTree.name: Magical Reserves
skillTree.description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.name: Inspiring Presence
skillTree.description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Piercing Thorns
skillTree.description: Every blade and barbed branch will eventually find its mark – when they do, the forest’s infinite anger is truly felt.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Bolts of the Forest
skillTree.description: Let each bolt be imbued with the strength of Kurnous, and bring death to all his enemies.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +4% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +6% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +4% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +8% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Striking Branches
skillTree.description: Let the enemy feel the fury of nature, embodied in these warriors as they crash through their lines.

effects.description:
Speed: +6% for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +9% for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +12% for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Swinging Boughs
skillTree.description: The warrior strikes with the strength of a swinging tree limb; few can stand against such strength.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Ancient Bark
skillTree.description: Centuries upon centuries of existence have given these ancient Tree Spirits a natural armour, mitigating any physical blows dealt against them.

effects.description:
Armour: +6 for Tree Kin and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +9 for Tree Kin and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 3% for Tree Kin and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +12 for Tree Kin and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 6% for Tree Kin and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Wings of the Forest
skillTree.description: Not all of the forest's guardians are rooted to the ground – flying enemies will always be in danger from the woodland's airborne protectors.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +6% for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +4% for Hawk Riders units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +9% for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +8% for Hawk Riders units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Shield of the Forest
skillTree.description: Armour as hard as the ancient bark of the forest, it repels blows that would rend others asunder.

effects.description:
Armour: +12 for Eternal Guard, Dryads, Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Eternal Guard, Dryads, Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Eternal Guard, Dryads, Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Nature's Quiver
skillTree.description: What is a ranger without an arrow? Who can be the best without dozens?

effects.description:
Ammunition: +20% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Swift & Sturdy
skillTree.description: Moving like the wind, whistling past tree branches, the riders of the forest hunt any who would do harm to the place they call home.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5 Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Glade Riders, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: The Forest's Roar
skillTree.description: All of Athel Loren shouts with a fury as old as the ages, and the enemy knows its power.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Ever-Reaching Tendrils
skillTree.description: The denizens of the forest will travel many miles to see those who would threaten Athel Loren put to rout.

skillTree.name: Wonders of the Forest
skillTree.description: Athel Loren provides for its deserving children, with wondrous boons gifted in recognition of their many endeavours.

skillTree.name: Nature's Salve
skillTree.description: The Worldroots provide succour for their children, purging the forests of any corrupting infestation.

skillTree.name: Obscuring Canopy
skillTree.description: The magics of the woods obscure and connive, able to turn enemy blades away from their targets.

skillTree.name: Growth of the Forest
skillTree.description: The forest provides for its warriors, rehabilitating and regenerating wounds suffered in its defence.

skillTree.name: Open Branches
skillTree.description: From all corners of the forest, they come to defend their homes.

skillTree.name: Lightning Strike
skillTree.description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.name: Swiftfingers
skillTree.description: The dead do not want for material possessions, yet the living may yet find value in them…

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.name: Perenniality
skillTree.description: Like the forest itself, the warriors of Athel Loren ebb and flow and regenerate with the passing of time.

skillTree.name: Quartermaster
skillTree.description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.

skillTree.name: Home Amongst the Boughs
skillTree.description: The forest-dwellers draw from the strength of Kurnous to fight ever harder, and be ever stronger.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.name: Mystifying Miasma [HIDDEN]
backgroundSkills.description: The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.

ui_effects.description: Strong vs 25 men unit or above

backgroundSkills.name: Briarmaven of Woe
backgroundSkills.description: Long ago, Drycha held court on the tainted ground where Morghur’s blood was spilt amongst the roots of the once-glorious Tree of Woe.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Dryads units
	(Lord's army)
Attacks cause the "Dampened" effect, reducing Magic Resistance
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Okkam's Mindrazor"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"
Enables completion of the quest chain to free the imprisoned Legendary Hero Coeddil

items.name: Fang of Taalroth
items.description: Many in the realms of men believe this powerful dampener of magic was once carried by their God of Nature, Taal himself.
